Articles.Content:
Hi all,

I'm looking for some assistance from people who use my mods.

There is a type of memory leak which can also cause some odd  issues at times.  I've been working on eliminating them from my mods, and have made a lot of progress.

What I need from everyone is to install the mod:  KSP Community Fixes, and then play the game.  When done, send me your Player.Log file so I can analyze it and find any open errors.

I would need to  you have the latest versions of all mods installed, and of course, this would need to be on a 1.12.3 game.

In most cases, the fix is pretty simple, so as I get the reports, I'll be able to fix and release updates.

 

If you don't know where to get the Player.log file, read the following link:

Read this BEFORE asking for support: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/83212-how-to-get-support-read-first/

Edited August 31, 2022 by linuxgurugamer

Here's a log with some leaks. I haven't looked carefully to see whether the leaks are mostly your mods or other mods. https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nJMUutmVv_s0tbg7kdpVaD9J2SHDmIrz/view?usp=sharing

All mods are current according to CKAN. Scatterer is an exception because GPP still needs Scatterer 0.07xx.

On 8/31/2022 at 4:21 PM, linuxgurugamer said:

I'm looking for some assistance from people

We're not assisting you, you are assisting us Thanks.

35 minutes ago, DeadJohn said:

Here's a log with some leaks. I haven't looked carefully to see whether the leaks are mostly your mods or other mods. https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nJMUutmVv_s0tbg7kdpVaD9J2SHDmIrz/view?usp=sharing

All mods are current according to CKAN. Scatterer is an exception because GPP still needs Scatterer 0.07xx.

We're not assisting you, you are assisting us Thanks.

Out of that entire file, one was mine:  WaypointManager.  Will be fixed shortly.

Going to keep this one around, can be useful as a reference if I decide to start fixing some other mods

56 minutes ago, DeadJohn said:

Here's a log with some leaks. I haven't looked carefully to see whether the leaks are mostly your mods or other mods. https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nJMUutmVv_s0tbg7kdpVaD9J2SHDmIrz/view?usp=sharing

All mods are current according to CKAN. Scatterer is an exception because GPP still needs Scatterer 0.07xx.

We're not assisting you, you are assisting us Thanks.

Waypoint Manager has been updated to 2.8.3.4, may take a little time to get updated in CKAN.  I'd appreciate if you could test it and let me know

10 hours ago, linuxgurugamer said:

Waypoint Manager has been updated to 2.8.3.4, may take a little time to get updated in CKAN.  I'd appreciate if you could test it and let me know

Updated Waypoint Manager and new log attached. https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EMoSsTCJkE4uZV7YLMO94C_3VCcDJK43/view?usp=sharing

My testing included picking a contract that created a waypoint, changing waypoints in the Contract Manager window, manually adding and deleting a waypoint. Holler if you need more specific testing of Waypoint Manager functionality.

The logfile is huge because of nullref messages from Conformal Decals. I don't think I was getting that before but I doubt your change is too blame. More likely cause is one of the flags I picked, the tapered KAX tail where I attached them, or just the length of the plane flight I did for a contract.

Edited September 3, 2022 by DeadJohn

4 hours ago, DeadJohn said:

Updated Waypoint Manager and new log attached. https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EMoSsTCJkE4uZV7YLMO94C_3VCcDJK43/view?usp=sharing

My testing included picking a contract that created a waypoint, changing waypoints in the Contract Manager window, manually adding and deleting a waypoint. Holler if you need more specific testing of Waypoint Manager functionality.

The logfile is huge because of nullref messages from Conformal Decals. I don't think I was getting that before but I doubt your change is too blame. More likely cause is one of the flags I picked, the tapered KAX tail where I attached them, or just the length of the plane flight I did for a contract.

WaypointManager is fixed, according to the log.

Have you notified @cineboxandrew about all the Nullrefs in ConformalDecals?

34 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:

WaypointManager is fixed, according to the log.

Have you notified @cineboxandrew about all the Nullrefs in ConformalDecals?

Not yet. I wasn't getting that log spam with decals on rockets. The plane I used to test Waypoint Manager seems to trigger them. I saw your PM and will test later.
